page.title: 16INTERESTING HOUSES
page.content: The Poplars, in Broad Street, Black Torrington, is over 300 years old. It was once a farmhouse but now forms part of a terrace in the centre of the village. On the wall is a fire mark, an ancient type of certificate of insurance in case of fire. Bampfylde House was formerly the rectory. It was built by Rev Bampfylde in 1830 but sold when the modern rectory was built. The school hall was the old tithe barn and Wistaria was the rectory stables. Maltster's Cottage was a store and workshop for a brewery which once stood on the site of the public hall. Long Hall was a saddler's, Devonia a blacksmith's and The Old Bakery a baker's. Duckingstool Cottage, 200 years old, was named after the place where witches or scolds were ducked in the stream.
